name: Serengeti National Park
metaTitle: Serengeti National Park Safari | Snow Africa Adventure
metaDescription: Experience the world-famous Serengeti and witness the Great Migration. Expert-guided safaris from Arusha.
description: The Serengeti is Tanzania's oldest and most popular national park, renowned worldwide for hosting the Great Wildebeest Migration. Covering 14,763 square kilometers, the name comes from the Maasai word 'siringet' meaning 'endless plains'. Home to over 3,000 lions, it offers unparalleled wildlife viewing year-round.
bestTime: June to October for dry season; December to March for calving season

name: Ngorongoro Conservation Area
metaTitle: Ngorongoro Crater Safari | Snow Africa Adventure
metaDescription: Visit the world's largest intact volcanic caldera. See the Big Five in one day at Ngorongoro Crater.
description: The Ngorongoro Crater is often called the 'Garden of Eden' and the 'Eighth Wonder of the World'. This UNESCO World Heritage Site is the world's largest intact volcanic caldera, home to approximately 25,000 animals including the endangered black rhino.

name: Tarangire National Park
metaTitle: Tarangire National Park Safari | Snow Africa Adventure
metaDescription: See huge elephant herds and ancient baobab trees at Tarangire. Less crowded alternative to Serengeti.
description: Tarangire National Park is famous for its large elephant herds (up to 300 in a group) and iconic baobab trees. During the dry season, the Tarangire River is a lifeline for wildlife, attracting massive concentrations of animals.
bestTime: June to October for best wildlife concentration

name: Lake Manyara National Park
metaTitle: Lake Manyara National Park Safari | Snow Africa Adventure
metaDescription: Discover tree-climbing lions and flamingo-filled shores at Lake Manyara National Park.
description: Lake Manyara National Park is a compact gem known for its tree-climbing lions and vast flocks of flamingos. The park offers diverse ecosystems from groundwater forest to open savanna, all set against the dramatic backdrop of the Rift Valley escarpment.
bestTime: July to October for wildlife; November to June for birds

name: Arusha National Park
metaTitle: Arusha National Park Safari | Snow Africa Adventure
metaDescription: Game drives and walking safaris in the shadow of Mount Meru. Perfect day trip from Arusha.
description: Arusha National Park is a gem often overlooked by visitors rushing to the more famous parks. Dominated by Mount Meru, Tanzania's second-highest peak, this park offers walking safaris, canoeing, and excellent birdwatching just 45 minutes from Arusha city.
bestTime: Year-round, June to February for climbing Mount Meru

name: Ruaha National Park
metaTitle: Ruaha National Park Safari | Snow Africa Adventure
metaDescription: Tanzania's largest national park. Remote wilderness with large predator populations.
description: Ruaha National Park is Tanzania's largest national park, covering over 20,000 square kilometers. This remote wilderness is home to 10% of the world's lion population and some of the largest elephant herds in East Africa.
bestTime: June to November during dry season

name: Selous Game Reserve
metaTitle: Selous Game Reserve Safari | Snow Africa Adventure
metaDescription: Africa's largest game reserve. Boat safaris on the Rufiji River and walking safaris.
description: Selous Game Reserve (now Nyerere National Park) is one of the largest protected wilderness areas in Africa. Famous for its boat safaris on the Rufiji River and walking safaris, it offers a truly off-the-beaten-path experience.
bestTime: June to October for game viewing; January to March for birding

name: Mikumi National Park
metaTitle: Mikumi National Park Safari | Snow Africa Adventure
metaDescription: Accessible safari destination near Dar es Salaam. Great wildlife viewing and affordable safaris.
description: Mikumi National Park is the fourth-largest park in Tanzania and the most accessible from Dar es Salaam. The Mkata Floodplain draws comparisons to the Serengeti, with excellent lion and elephant sightings.
bestTime: Year-round, best during dry season (May to November)

name: Katavi National Park
metaTitle: Katavi National Park Safari | Snow Africa Adventure
metaDescription: Remote and untouched wilderness in western Tanzania. Massive hippo and buffalo populations.
description: Katavi National Park is one of Tanzania's most remote and untouched wilderness areas. During the dry season, the Katuma River and seasonal lakes attract thousands of hippos, crocodiles, and buffalo in spectacular concentrations.
bestTime: July to October for best wildlife viewing

name: Gombe Stream National Park
metaTitle: Gombe Stream National Park | Chimpanzee Trekking
metaDescription: Jane Goodall's famous chimpanzee research site. Trek to see wild chimps on Lake Tanganyika shores.
description: Gombe Stream National Park is where Jane Goodall began her groundbreaking chimpanzee research in 1960. This small but precious park on the shores of Lake Tanganyika offers intimate chimp trekking experiences.
bestTime: July to October (dry season), February for best photography

name: Mahale Mountains National Park
metaTitle: Mahale Mountains National Park | Wild Chimps
metaDescription: Remote chimp trekking in the Mahale Mountains. Pristine beaches on Lake Tanganyika.
description: Mahale Mountains National Park is one of the most remote and beautiful parks in Africa. Home to approximately 800 chimpanzees, it offers exceptional primate trekking combined with pristine Lake Tanganyika beaches.
bestTime: May to October for chimp trekking

name: Rubondo Island National Park
metaTitle: Rubondo Island National Park | Lake Victoria Safari
metaDescription: Unique island safari on Lake Victoria. Wild chimps, sitatunga, and incredible fishing.
description: Rubondo Island National Park is a unique archipelago in the southwestern corner of Lake Victoria. This off-the-beaten-path destination offers chimpanzee tracking, sport fishing, and unique wildlife including the elusive sitatunga.
bestTime: November to February for birds; June to August for chimps

name: Udzungwa Mountains National Park
metaTitle: Udzungwa Mountains National Park | Hiking & Primates
metaDescription: Hiking paradise in the Eastern Arc Mountains. Waterfalls, endemic primates, and biodiversity hotspot.
description: Udzungwa Mountains National Park is part of the ancient Eastern Arc Mountains, a biodiversity hotspot with more endemic species than the Galapagos. It's a hiking paradise with no roads inside the park.
bestTime: June to October for hiking; year-round for primates

name: Kitulo National Park
metaDescription: The 'Serengeti of Flowers'. Tanzania's only botanical national park with stunning highland wildflowers.
description: Kitulo National Park, nicknamed the 'Serengeti of Flowers', is Tanzania's first botanical national park. This highland plateau bursts with wildflowers from November to April, including over 350 species of vascular plants and 45 species of orchids.

name: Mkomazi National Park
metaTitle: Mkomazi National Park Safari | Rhino Sanctuary
metaDescription: Black rhino and wild dog sanctuary near Kilimanjaro. Off-the-beaten-path safari destination.
description: Mkomazi National Park is a vast wilderness area adjacent to Kenya's Tsavo National Park. The park is home to a black rhino sanctuary and African wild dog conservation project, offering intimate wildlife encounters away from the crowds.
bestTime: June to October for wildlife viewing
